title: Development and operation of East Container Terminal and West Container Terminal of the Colombo South Port
decision_details:
- A Memorandum of Cooperation has been entered into between Sri Lanka, India and Japan for the development of the East Container Terminal of the Colombo South Port. The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2020-10-26 granted approval to appoint a Negotiating Committee to evaluate an investment proposal submitted by an Indian investor in accordance with the provisions of the said Agreement. Accordingly, the following proposals made by the Minister of Ports and Shipping based on the recommendations submitted by the aforesaid Negotiating Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

    • to operate the East Container Terminal as a fully owned container terminal of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority.
      
    • to take necessary action to develop the West Container Terminal of Colombo South Port as a Public Private Partnership by the parties nominated by India and Japan in association with the Sri Lanka Ports Authority on the basis of returning the same within 35 years, with a view to developing Colombo Port as a competitive port in this region and to adopt the International Agreements signed by the Government of Sri Lanka.
